Interesting to say the least.
 
 1- You almost certainly will be called into active duty.
 
 2- It has to be a cause you believe in strongly enough to risk your life for.
 
 Apparently the combination of 1 & 2, is causing some serious problems.
 
 http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/7802712/
 
 Maybe it should be sounding a few alarm bells as well.
 
 Waxy
It would appear that most Americans do not support this war on terror enough to actually fight in it. I wonder how many current military troops would quit if the had the opportunity?
I think they support the War on Terror out of fear.

I think they support the War on Terror out of fear.

 No....
 I'm not afraid. Maybe that's why I AM supporting it. And no, I wouldn't quit if I had the chance, and I don't know anyone that I work around that whould.
 
 I'll admit, I had to be dragged into that recruiting office by my brother and his friends, but they got a big THANK YOU in the end. 
 
 It's not all about the war  either. It's being there to support your country if some idiot attacks. I'd rather be fighting than huddled up in a hole somewhere with people complaining why America doesn't respond faster when something happens. Maybe because most American's are just talk.
 Everyone wants the easy life though, and expects someone else to fight for them.
 THAT'S the problem
